reviewsJson.markdown:
**Setup:** Narda Clone, Single coil  26g Kanthal @.7 ohms.  25W Power, Half wicked with Tencel

**Testing:** Hangsen Chocolate Cream @ 2%. 70/30 VG/PG, steeped 17 days.

**Flavor Description:**  This tastes more like a nutty cream with a touch of chocolate. It is fairly sour or bitter tasting. My palate is not refined enough to be able to distinguish what kind of nuts I am tasting but it is not peanuts. I am quite honestly having a tough time describing this flavor. I really hope I can get some help in the comments. It is very powerful tasting with just a hint of chocolate note in the background.

**Off-flavors:**  The whole thing tastes off to me, I was expecting a chocolate flavor and instead I get this strong, nutty note.

**Throat Hit:**  This flavor is moderately harsh on its own due to its dryness.

**Uses & Pairings:**  I got this flavor solely for [Minty down Under v2](https://alltheflavors.com/recipes/18731) by /u/rageisalotofwork. Otherwise I would use this maybe in sunday type mixes where you want some nuts as well as a touch of chocolate, it will also bolster the ice cream as this flavor is quite creamy. It would also be good in a milkshake where that nuttiness would bring a malty affect to your ice cream. 

**Notes:**
I haven't quite decided if I like this flavor or not lol. I think I need to mix with it more but it is very strange to me. I get way more chocolate in inw chocolate cream which also has a nice nutty taste. I am going to find it hard to come up with uses for this.


**[DIY_eJuice Flavor Reviews](https://www.reddit.com/r/DIY_eJuice/wiki/index/flavor_reviews)**

If you have different opinions on the flavor or any ideas on how to use it please post them in the comments. Lets start a discussion!
reviewsJson.author: mlNikon
reviewsJson.title: Chocolate Cream
